title: Missoula Training Race
description: The Missoula Training race is a fun but competitive event. There are three racing categories to choose from - A experienced and competitive, B- Intermediate racer, C - New racers.
course: The Clinton training race starts at Noon. The course is held on a 7.75 mile loop using the north and south side frontage roads west of Clinton, MT.  The loop is mostly flat save for one short rise. The race will be run as a pursuit, the Category C racers will start first and then the next two groups will depart at 5 min intervals.  The first rider, regardless of category, wins the race.
registration: Registration will take place on the morning of the race at Missoula Bicycle Works located at 708 So. Higgins Ave; Missoula, MT. Registration opens at 9:00am
notes: Many riders choose to ride out to the Start line in Clinton.  It is about a one hour ride from Missoula
directions: From Missoula travel east on I-90 until you reach the Clinton exit #120 about twenty miles from Missoula. Head south and turn right on the old frontage road before crossing the tracks. Staging will take place at the old frontage road.

title: Collin Craig Memorial Series - Country Side Criter

Please note that registration is for the entire series only ($25).
directions: From Jack Rabbit Lane in Belgrade head west on Amsterdam Rd approximately one mile, turn south on River Farm Rd for a quarter mile to the start/finish area.

title: Collin Craig Memorial Series - Springhill TT
Herron Hammer
description: Herron Hammer XC Mountain Bike Race
registration: Online registration and day-of registration available.  Day-of registration is from 8:00-9:30 AM at the picnic shelter on the hill.
directions: From Hwy 93 :  Turn onto Rocky Cliff Rd. (south of Kalispell), turn left at the intersection with Airport Rd.  Stay on Airport Rd (which turns into Foys Canyon Rd) until you get to Herron Park.

title: Collin Craig Memorial Series - Bridger/Jackson Cre
Kettle House Beer League
description: Kettle House Weekday Race League Series. Wednesday nights at Marshall Mountain.
registration: Online registration open until 10 am day of race, can register day of at Marshall Mountain from 5-5:30 pm prior to race. Cost is $10 per race with USAC license and $15 per race if no license.
directions: Located at Marshall Mountain 7 miles form downtown Missoula. From Van Buren I 90 Exit take East Broadway towards East Missoula. East Broadway is also called Highway 200. Follow East Broadway/Hwy 200 for roughly 3.6 miles. Turn left on to Marshall Canyon Road (There will be a Marshall Resort Sign). Take Marshall Canyon Road for 2.7 miles. Parking is in the lot before the gate or along the road. Race Registration is in the base parking lot under the tent.

title: Mission Shadow Time Trial - State Championship
MT Alpha Cycling MTB Skills Clinic
Homestake XC Mountain Bike Race
description: The race will be held at Homestake Lodge, a cross country ski area at the top of Homestake pass on I-90, just east of Butte, and on Forest Service land backing the XC ski area.  The course is a 7 mile loop comprised of double-track and single track.  The course will be fast, rolling terrain that will suit all around riders.  Registration is from 9:30 AM – 10:30 A.M; the race will begin at 11:00 A.M.
registration: Online registration available through USAC. Fee for registration is $25 up to the day of the race. Price increases to $35.
notes: Part of the MORS and State Championship Series.
directions: To get to Homestake Lodge, take the Homestake exit from I-90 at the top of Homestake pass. On the south side of the interstate, turn onto FS 240 road for 3 miles, paralleling I-90 eastward.  The road is manageable for most vehicles.  Post race awards will be done at the lodge.

title: Dirt Divas MTB Clinic
description:
All Womens MTB clinic. Skill categories - Beginner, Intermediate, and Advanced. $50 includes schwag, lunch, and after-ride food/libations. Lunch time information stations to cover on-trail bike maintenance, flat repair, stretching, Hammer nutrition, to name a few. Registration to open mid-April.
BEGINNER – Minimal time spent riding a mountain bike with little/no experience riding single-track trails. INTERMEDIATE– Ride a mountain bike on single-track trails but wary to ride technical trail sections with rocks and roots.
registration:
Register in advance through active.com
Registration Closing Date
Thursday, June 13, 2013 @ 11:59 PM PST

title: MTB Kids' Camp w/ Cris Winner
description:
Come out and join Cris Winner to learn the fundamentals of cross country mountain bike riding, meet the pros before the Hammer Nutrition Missoula XC, and have a great time!

Who: The camp is recommended for boys and girls, 4th-8th grade.
When: June 17-21, 8:30am-5:00pm
Where: Marshall Mountain
How much: $190 for the week.

Campers will need a bike and a helmet, and comfortable, well-fitting clothes and shoes.
registration: Online registration is available at www.missoulaxc.org.
directions: The camp is located at and around Marshall Mountain.

title: Hammer Nutrition Missoula XC at Marshall Mountain

address.street: Bohart Ranch, 16621 Bridger Canyon Road, Bozeman, MT

title: Beartooth Blitz
description: What started as a small community ride up the Beartooth Pass, has grown to one of Montana's most epic road bike races. The all-new Beartooth Ride, is now a two-day stage sure to test your legs.   This year's additional will include a 40 mile road bike race, a crit and the Time Trial.
course:
August 10th - A 40-mile road bike race through the Stillwater River Valley. This day's activities start at Montana Jack's in Dean. Racers head east on a mostly downhill course to the small town of Fishtail. Once in Fishtail its back up to Dean and past the starting line. After a short category-5 climb, racers rocket down into the small town of Nye and into the Stillwater River drainage. At mile marker 30 its back toward Dean for the final climb of the day. This 4-mile category-3 climb will either be a great place to drop the pack, or feel the lead in your legs.   
Saturday evening's crit will be held in Red Lodge Montana.

August 11th - The run up Beartooth Pass was the climb that started it all. Recently named one of the 5 top bike climbs in the nation, the Beartooth Pass is a once-in-a-lifetime ride. The day's activities start at Rock Creek Resort, located 6 miles south of Red Lodge. Racers will leave in 30-second intervals in a time trial format. This category 1 climb rises up over 4,700 feet during its span of 23 miles. So you better enjoy the 66 feet of descending grade that you get at the starting line. The race ends at the scenic West Summit of the Beartooth Pass.
registration: Online registration available at US cycling.  Price increase on July 11, 2013.  Online registration ends August 8, 2013.  Day of Registration is available but racers are not promised tshirts.
notes:
CASH PRIZES TO OVERALL 2 DAY CHAMPIONS
    Men CAT 1/2 - 2 Day Over All Champion $60
    Men CAT 3 - 2 Day Over All Champion $60
    Men CAT 4 - 2 Day Over All Champion $60
    Men CAT 5 - 2 Day Over All Champion $60
    Male Masters (40+) - 2 Day Over All Champion $60
    Jr's 10-18 Places - 2 Day Over All Champion $60
    Women CAT 1/2/3 - 2 Day Over All Champion $60
    Women CAT 4 - 2 Day Over All Champion $60
    Female Masters (40+) - 2 Day Over All Champion $60

Medals and Prizes awarded at the finish of each event to winners.
directions:
August 10, 2013 race at http://www.mapquest.com/?version=1.0&hk=4-F5kQt49l
August 11, 2013 race at http://www.mapquest.com/?version=1.0&hk=5-9uacNuHl

title: Huckleberry 100
description: Huckleberry 100-Offers the perfect mix of gritty challenge and breathtaking beauty, promising to be one of the most scenic cycling courses of 2013.  Choose from a short family ride or a longer 25, 50, or 100 mile ride through the Flathead Valley.
course: You will start in historic Kalispell, visit gorgeous Big Fork on the shore of Flathead Lake and make your way to the scenic ski/snowboard town of Whitefish. The end of the ride brings you to plenty of food and and Bikes and Berries Fest! Huckleberry's are rare and tasty, so is this ride.
registration: Registration for the 2013 Huckleberry 100 is open now at http://www.active.com.
directions: Located in downtown Kalispell, the ride starts at 7:30 am at 120 First Ave East.  Line up begins on the corner of 1st Avenue East and E.Center Street.  Across from Depot Park

title: Big Fish XC
description: The 2013 State Championship Cross Country Race hosted by The Sportsman & Ski Haus will be held at The Whitefish Mountain Resort September 14th at 10:00 a.m.
course: This is a classic xc course worthy of a world cup level event!  A nice long climb on single track to a short dirt road section into a fun fast decent down the summit trail.
directions: Registration and race start is at the ski shop on at The Whitefish Mountain Resort

description: Cyclocross at the Helena Trap Club.

directions: Exit I-15 at Custer Ave. Turn west to N. Montana. Head North to 5505 N.Montana Ave. Helena Trap Club on East side of N. Montana.

title: Wolf Point Dam Bike Ride
description: A breathtaking out and back 105-mile ride from Wolf Point to the Fort Peck Dam and back along the Missouri River on rural county roads with very few motorists. Or, choose from a 23-mile or 67-mile option (no lunch included). Free outdoor camping at the city park (where the race begins and ends).  Free indoor camping at the Lutheran church (2 blocks from the park).
course: An out and back 105-mile ride from Wolf Point to the Fort Peck Dam and back along the Missouri River on rural county roads with very few motorists.
registration:
Free outdoor camping at the city park (where the race begins and ends).  Free indoor camping at the Lutheran church (2 blocks from the park).
•Packet pick-up and free dinner Friday from 5-7pm
•Riders Meeting: Friday at 7pm
•Packet pick-up Saturday morning 7-8am
